questions.question_text: If a user has public read-only access to records [that he/she does not own], the following are true.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ADE
=> https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.sharing_model_fields.htm&type=5

Public Read Only 
All users can view and report on records but not edit them. Only the owner, and users above that role in the hierarchy, can edit those records.

choices.A: The user can view the record but not edit it
choices.E: The user can report on the record
choices.B: The user can view and delete the record, but not edit it
choices.C: The user can change the owner of the record
choices.D: The user can search for the record

discussion.content: Starting in Summer ’13, the partner-portal is no longer available for orgs that aren’t currently using it. Existing orgs continue to have fullaccess. If you don’t have a partner-portal, but want to easily share records and information with your partners, try Experience Cloud sites.Existing orgs using partner-portals may continue to use their partner-portals or transition to Experience Cloud sites. Contact your SalesforceAccount Executive for more information

choices.C: Data goes into your Salesforce objects through a third party site
choices.A: Use your company logo on a Partner Site
choices.B: Develop Partner Application on Force.com Platform

questions.question_text: Maximum number of values allowed in a controlling field is:
Which of the following are not standard objects?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
According to the following site

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.object_reference.meta/object_reference/sforce_api_objects_list.htm

 For Sure C is correct (it is not a standard object).
However, "Solution" is among the list of Salesforce Standard Objects.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.object_reference.meta/object_reference/sforce_api_objects_solution.htm

C is the correct Answer
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.object_reference.meta/object_reference/sforce_api_objects_solution.htm

Selected Answer: C
Job Applicants
“Solutions “ is not a standard object in modern Salesforce setups…

Selected Answer: C
Job Applicants are not standard objects.

Selected Answer: C
Job Applicants are not standard objects.

In a database or software application, an object is a collection of data and the methods or functions that operate on that data. Standard objects are pre-defined objects that are included in the database or application by default, and are typically used to store and manage common types of data.

Selected Answer: C
Solution is displayed in Schema-B, but its details cant be viewed. But yes, it exists as a std-O
Solution is standard object https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.object_reference.meta/object_reference/sforce_api_objects_solution.htm
I believe Solutions is in Classic, that's why it won't show in Lightning but still exist

No doubt "Job Application" 
To verify check schema builder standard object
if you look in the schema builder solutions is listed under standard objects
Solution and job applicant
Solution object is not available whatsoever. It's an incorrect option.
Solutions and Job applicant
job applicant is not a standared object
Job applicant
Solutions is a standard object.

B. Solutions
does not look to be a stranded object
